data.job_title: Associate Front End Developer (DIN-02A) // US or GC // On-Site Chevy Chase, MD
data.job_description:
About the Opportunity
• We are only considering US Citizens and Green Card holders for this position. We are unable to sponsor for this role.
• We are only considering candidates who currently reside within 35 minutes of postal code 20815
• No Third Parties
• Must be able to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination and booster
• $40 per hour 1099
• Location: 100% Onsite Chevy Chase, Maryland
• Job Id: DIN-02A
• Hours are M-F, 9am - 6pm with 1 hour lunch break
• Modern, light, and spacious work environment
• Free parking, snacks, and gym membership for this role
• Contract Term: 1 year with possible extension based upon performance

Short Description

We are seeking an Associate Front End Developer with software development project team experience to compose, enhance, unit test, deploy, and support quality code. The ideal candidate must have 3+ years of professional software project development, 3+ years of HTML5/CSS/Javascript, and 1+ years of working on project teams utilizing SDLC.

Required Skills/Years of Experience:
• Bachelor of Science Degree in IT (or associated field)
• 3+ years of excellent verbal and written communication skills
• 2+ years of experience using MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
• 2+ years of HTML5
• 2+ years of Javascript
• 2+ years of CSS3
• 1+ years of JQuery
• 1+ years of GIT
• 1+ years of professional software project development experience
• 1+ years of Bootstrap
• 1+ years of applying responsive web design concepts and approaches
• 1+ years of participating in agile events and ceremonies
• 1+ years of authoring code from requirements, UI design, wireframes, and/or mockups
• 1+ years of working as part of a project team
• 1+ years of SDLC
• 1+ years of working on web applications
• 1+ years of experience deploying applications

Desired Skills/Years of Experience:
• AWS Cloud Practitioner
• AWS Certified Developer
• 1+ years of running or supporting applications on AWS
• 1+ years of Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides
• 1+ years of troubleshooting issues/bugs and supporting production issues

Description

For over 20 years, organizations have come to depend on Dantech for our IT expertise, quality, and customer service. We have helped startups, companies of all sizes, educational institutions, government agencies, associations, and international firms securely and efficiently transform and scale their IT, the way they work, and meet the demands of their customers.

The Associate Front End Developer will play an integral role in the delivery of solutions required to continue providing high quality service to our clients. This role will transform communicated needs and requirements into user-friendly, responsive, and appealing interactive web and mobile applications. The Front End Developer will develop, document, test, and deliver internally and externally facing software that adheres to industry and Dantech best practice and that satisfies delivery goals.

The ideal candidate is eager to learn, to deliver quality, and to be flexible regarding possible technical and operational solutions, approaches, and strategies. For this role, you should be able to work efficiently, communicate effectively, and be obsessed with high quality code and deliverables that meet assigned timeframes.

Responsibilities:
• Become a highly valued, contributing member of the Dantech Team
• Be courteous, kind, constructive, eager to learn, reliable, and professional at all times
• Adhere to all Dantech policies and protocols
• Be flexible and adaptable as technical and operational requirements do change
• Learn quickly and document/update documentation accordingly
• Complete assigned training and/or exercises, within requested timeframes
• Obtain technical accreditations and certifications, as assigned, within requested timeframes
• Become a Subject Matter Expert by reading and leveraging existing Dantech project documentation
• Adhere to Dantech technology standards and practices
• Develop high quality code that meets all technical and performance requirements
• Design, develop, troubleshoot, and maintain scripts and UI code
• Accept feedback graciously and resolve to address issues or concerns
• Design, develop, troubleshoot, and maintain reusable UI components
• Implement provided style guides as requested
• Extensively unit test code and scripts
• Participate in solution reviews to ensure work is appropriately designed and effectively tuned for platform performance and client expectation
• Contribute to the overall quality of the Dantech Team solutions deliveries
• Implement consistent, resilient, secure, and scalable solutions
• Deliver solutions with accompanying assets (i.e., Confluence page, GitHub code) on time
• Participate in agile ceremonies and events
• Update agile boards as required
• Complete weekly timesheets and expense reports
• Support the Dantech project manager in preparing statuses, presentations, or other deliverables
• Support internal projects and office functions
• Complete additional tasks, as requested

Hiring Expectations
• We are only considering US Citizens and Green Card holders for this position. We are unable to sponsor this role.
• No Third Parties
• Expect technical interview screening
• Expect F2F interview
• Background checks and verifications will be required

About Dantech

Dantech Corporation, Inc. is a Certified Business Enterprise (CBE) in the District of Columbia and a federally recognized Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB). The company has a history of technology, innovation and transformation since its launch in 1999. As an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. For more information, please see: www.dantechcorp.com.

data.job_description:
Location: Los Angeles, CA

Employment Type: Full-time

Team: Own & Operated

Hi, We're Centerfield.
Centerfield is a cutting-edge digital marketing and sales technology company headquartered in the heart of Silicon Beach with additional offices in New York, Boston, Florida, and Jamaica. Our growing organization continues to impact the AdTech space by providing end-to-end customer acquisition services and analytics for our high-profile clients, while also successfully tailoring every step of the customer's shopping experience.

How do we do this? Centerfield develops intelligent Big Data driven marketing and sales technology which drives more than two million sales each year for brands such as AT&T, Sprint, ADT, Spectrum, and CenturyLink. Our technology platform, Dugout, combined with our leading consumer guides and 1500 person sales and retention center deliver new customers at scale to top residential services, business services, and telecommunications brands worldwide.

We’re always interested in expanding our team with top talent. Our creative work environment allows for innovative ideas and encourages a collaborative team culture... make sure to check out our perks below!

The Opportunity...
You will develop intelligent digital advertising technology focused on real-time biddable media and voice call routing. In addition, you will be building and maintaining internal and external-facing web applications and systems using ReactJS, Javascript, WebPack, PHP, and Sass. You will interface with business operators, product and project managers as well as other teams within the company to develop new functionality on existing software products and participate in agile software development. We provide developers with top-notch tools to be productive. We offer a wide range of technologies and opportunities for developers to learn and experiment with those technologies. We routinely update and improve our code and infrastructure and expect our developers to drive those improvements. Centerfield is a learning environment; developers will be challenged to learn new technologies and bring new technologies to the team. We expect developers to take ownership of projects and get their code into production. You will make significant contributions to our success. And while we do all this, we have fun.
What We're Looking For...
• Minimum 1 years developing applications using ReactJS
• Minimum 2 years developing frontend heavy applications using Javascript, WebPack, Sass, HTML5, CSS, and PHP
• Minimum 1 years developing WordPress sites
• Proven experience leading technical projects
• Hands-on experience working in an Agile product development environment
• Basic understanding of software design patterns
• Hands-on experience and a good understanding of Git/GitHub and source code management best practices

Life at Centerfield...
• Competitive salary + quarterly bonus
• Unlimited PTO – take a break when you need it!
• Industry leading medical, dental, and vision plans + generous parental leave
• 401(k) company match plan – fully vested day 1
• Outside patio overlooking Playa Vista + cabanas, firepits & working grills
• Monthly happy hours, catered lunches + daily food trucks
• Award winning culture & unprecedented team spirit (featured in LA Business Journal & Built In LA)
• Fully stocked kitchens with snacks & drinks
• Large breakroom supplied with games, couches, workout equipment + weekly in-office exercise classes hosted by professional instructors (yoga, kickboxing & circuit training)
• Free onsite gym + locker rooms
• Paid charity and volunteer days (local mentor programs, adopt a pet, beach cleanup, etc.)
• Monthly team outings (ball games, casino night, hikes, etc.)
• Career growth – we enjoy promoting from within!#LI-Hybrid

To learn more, visit us Here.
Interviews will take place after resumes have been screened for minimum requirements. Please note that this position is not restricted solely to the responsibilities listed above and that the job scope and responsibilities are subject to change.

For more information about our collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information in connection with our evaluating your candidacy, please visit our Privacy Policy at https://www.centerfield.com/privacy-policy/.

Centerfield Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.

Qualifications: Minimum 1 years developing applications using ReactJS
Minimum 2 years developing frontend heavy applications using Javascript, WebPack, Sass, HTML5, CSS, and PHP
Minimum 1 years developing WordPress sites
Proven experience leading technical projects
Hands-on experience working in an Agile product development environment
Basic understanding of software design patterns
Hands-on experience and a good understanding of Git/GitHub and source code management best practices

In addition, you will be building and maintaining internal and external-facing web applications and systems using ReactJS, Javascript, WebPack, PHP, and Sass

You will interface with business operators, product and project managers as well as other teams within the company to develop new functionality on existing software products and participate in agile software development

data.job_description:
As our new Frontend Developer, you'll become part of our ambitious development team. Together, we're going to work on solving development tasks for forward-thinking US and international companies!

About the position

As our Frontend Developer, you'll be an essential part of a versatile team consisting of Solution Architects, Backend Developers, Digital Designers, UX Designers, Project Managers and Researchers. You will also join a professional community with the developers who are working on the same tech stack as yourself.

At Adapt you will get acquainted with both new and existing clients, though your main focus will be on one project at the time. On frontend heavy products we expect you to act as tech lead on the project. Today we are working with React and Vue and we are advancing quickly with modern e-commerce solution as well as headless and flat file CMS.

In short, with your level of experience, we expect you to help move our department forward in an ever-changing landscape of technology, and that you know the importance of Frontend development for the final result of a project. You care about developing yourself professionally and you're pleased with sharing your knowledge with your colleagues – just as you're not afraid to ask for their help and knowhow.

You'll be working with:
• Frontend architecture
• Modern JavaScript frameworks and libraries such as React and Vue in TypeScript
• Storefront solutions for modern commerce such as Big Commerce and CommerceTools
• Headless and FlatFile CMS
• Automated testing
• Advising our clients in relation to existing and upcoming solutions
• Estimation of project scope with the rest of the team
• Testing and quality assurance
• Attendance in internal knowledge sharing meetups

Who you are

First and foremost, we're looking for a Frontend Developer with experience who can navigate safely in the visual as well as the logical part of an application. Additionally, we value drive and initiative and that you're passionate about what you do. Having said that, we imagine that you'll be able to tickmark most of these items:
• Experience from a similar position
• Solid experience with development of solutions in a decoupled architecture
• Curious and innovative
• Knowledge of e-commerce
• Staying updated on the development of your area of expertise
• Experience with development for several browsers and devices
• Experience with one or more CMS systems – preferably headless
• Fluent in Git
• Courage to learn new things and develop your current skillset
• Jam stack
• Typescript

Who we are

Everyday life here at Adapt is spent as leaders within digital development. Years of experience with creating and improving digital solutions for our clients have made us who we are – a solid team of around 175 digitally savvy and exceptionally nice people. We value both personal and professional development, why we always have a roster of students and apprentices.

You will join our US team, but we also have offices around the world from Barcelona to Copenhagen to Vilnius. Working together with our clients is a key motivation, we value trust in each other highly and we are determined to maintain all the positive things we stand for.

Our US offices work closely with our EU colleagues. Because of this, we require that candidates are able to overlap with the EU for at least the hours of 9am - 11am eastern.

Qualifications: Modern JavaScript frameworks and libraries such as React and Vue in TypeScript
Attendance in internal knowledge sharing meetups

data.job_description:
RESULTS. INNOVATION. VALUES. ACCOUNTABILITY.

That’s RIVA. Our employee-first approach has manifested a culture that attracts the best and brightest. By investing in people firsts, and providing a flexible work environment, our employees have higher moral, higher productivity rates, and lower turnover. At RIVA, people are our #1 priority.
A Drupal Front ender is a web developer who specializes in creating the front-end of websites using Drupal, a popular open-source content management system (CMS).

The job requirements for a Drupal Front ender typically include:
• Extensive Experience in Drupal: The candidate should have experience in using Drupal to create websites, including customizing themes, creating custom modules, and implementing functionality.
• Strong Front-end Development Skills: The candidate should have a strong understanding of Twig, HTML, SCSS, and JavaScript, as well as experience with front-end frameworks such as Bootstrap, Foundation, Materialize, or USWDS.
• Extensive experience with Drupal Theming: The candidate should have extensive experience in Drupal theming, including creating and customizing Drupal themes, understanding of Drupal's theme system and template files, and the ability to create responsive designs. Experience translating design documents into pixel perfect twig templates.
• Understanding of Drupal's Module System: The candidate should have a good understanding of Drupal's module system and be able to integrate Drupal modules into custom themes.
• Understanding of Cross-browser Compatibility and Accessibility: The candidate should have a good understanding of cross-browser compatibility, accessibility, and web standards, including W3C guidelines and WCAG.
• Knowledge of SEO Best Practices: The candidate should have a good understanding of SEO best practices and be able to implement them in Drupal websites.
• Communication and Teamwork: The candidate should have excellent communication skills, be able to work effectively in a team environment, and be able to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
• Problem-solving and troubleshooting: The candidate should be able to troubleshoot problems and identify solutions to complex technical issues. Continuous learning: The candidate should have a willingness to learn and stay up-to-date with the latest Drupal technologies and best practices.
• Public Trust eligibility required.

RIVA Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any protect class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please email accommodations@rivasolutionsinc.com. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned.

Strong Front-end Development Skills: The candidate should have a strong understanding of Twig, HTML, SCSS, and JavaScript, as well as experience with front-end frameworks such as Bootstrap, Foundation, Materialize, or USWDS

Extensive experience with Drupal Theming: The candidate should have extensive experience in Drupal theming, including creating and customizing Drupal themes, understanding of Drupal's theme system and template files, and the ability to create responsive designs

Imply Data, Inc. seeks Frontend Engineers in Burlingame, CA.
• Build the UI to allow users to ingest data from different data sources using Typescript and React
• Build integration test using Playwright to ensure high-quality releases
• Build the UI for users to manage clusters at large scale using Typescript and React
• Collaborate with other engineers and product managers in an agile environment, and leverage scrum principles like daily standup meetups
• Articulate multiple courses of action, and assess costs and trade-offs
• Define and break work down into logical pieces, resolve problems as they occur
• Communicate work effectively to drive scalability
• Take ownership of the web-console in Apache Druid

What kind of software is being developed?

Response: A web application User Interface (UI) for operating a high-scale analytic database as a service (DBaaS). The web application makes it easy for users (including less technical ones) to design and manage schemas; connect and manage external data sources; perform batch extract-transform-load (ETL) ingestion of billions of rows and terabytes of data from various sources and data formats; do near real-time ELT ingestion from streaming sources; preview and manage data within the DBaaS; and see and tune performance.

What tools will be used to perform the development?

Response: TypeScript, React, Playwright, Apache Druid, Apache Kafka, and Amazon Web Services.

Requires a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field. Requires any amount of experience with the following: Building web-UI for enterprise software; Typescript and React or other javascript frameworks; Building production-grade software; Developing UI for SaaS-based applications; Working with Big Data Technologies or Complex Distributed systems like Apache Druid, Hadoop, or Kafka. Experience may be gained via coursework or employment. Telecommuting permitted.

40 hours/week, $117,000 – $143,000 per year. Must also have authority to work permanently in the U.S. Applicants who are interested in this position may apply at www.jobpostingtoday.com (Ref #69278) for consideration.

Description:

Who is Leafwell

Leafwell is a rapidly growing technology and data company that set out to increase access, education, and research into cannabis and to advance its application as medicine.

An exciting opportunity for a Senior Frontend Developer to join our growing team has arisen.

What to Expect as a Senior Frontend Developer at Leafwell

As a Senior Frontend Developer at Leafwell, you will contribute to the development and maintenance of our leafwell.com website and other websites to be made, working closely with other engineering teams to deliver a seamless, user-friendly experience for our users.

Day-To-Day Essential Duties and Responsibilities

The Senior Frontend Developer will perform the following responsibilities:
• Design, develop, and maintain high-quality web applications using React, Next.js, GraphQL, and Design systems.
• Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other developers to define and implement innovative solutions for complex problems.
• Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
• Optimize application performance to ensure fast loading times and smooth user experience.
• Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in frontend development and Design systems.

Why Leafwell

At Leafwell, we are passionate about our work and seek out employees who contribute the same level of dedication and enthusiasm. We are only as good as the people we hire, so we aim to be the best employer in order to attract the top talent in the industry.

Do we have your Interest?

Requirements:

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Senior Frontend Developer with experience in React, Next.js to join our team. As a Senior Frontend Developer at Leafwell, you will play a crucial role in enhancing the lives of medical cannabis patients through the development of our innovative telemedicine platform.

We work hard to provide a welcoming atmosphere where everyone may flourish, have a sense of belonging, and collaborate effectively. Position Summary...

What you'll do...
Walmart Corporate
Bentonville, AR

The Health Horizontal Infrastructure team is looking for a Sr. Software Engineer to focus on Automated Testing and Tooling. You will have experience in Java, Spring Boot, DevOps, CICD, Automated Testing, and Large-Scale Systems. You will focus on improving the testing and processes within the team. As we move toward a DevOps heavy process and organizational structure, proper testing and tools are important for us to achieve true CICD.

About NewBETs Health and Wellness:
Our team is focused on developing a streamlined company that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and Associate Digital Experience (ADE). We also provide a variety of services such as procurement, supplier portfolio management, merchandising master data, and analytics. From developing HR chatbots and virtual assistants to creating invoice solutions and facilitating legal changes, we help guide efficiency across Walmart globally. Walmart Global Tech's NewBETs Health and Wellness Data organization is a driving force behind our technology strategy across the Pharmacy, Vision, Omnichannel, and Digital lines of business in healthcare. We are working to bring empirical data into every conversation and to create common system infrastructures to consolidate system designs and create efficiencies around data-centric processes. We are a progressive technology group working in an Agile environment that is looking for technologists who want to solve complex, high-scale business problems. We are looking for leader with a technical background, experience leading engineers, and strong ownership.

What you'll do:

Lead medium- to large-scale projects by reviewing project requirements, translating requirements into technical solutions, gathering requested information, writing, and developing code, conducting unit testing. Communicating status and issues to team members and partners.
• Work in a Java service environment building tools to create efficiencies in automation testing.
• Create team technology and process standards.
• Write automated tests to ensure error-free code and performance. All technical members of the team write automated tests, but you will lead the direction and strategy for that work.
• Either individually or leading a team of resources, determines hardware/software systems requirements and leads systems hardware/software design. Analyze, designs, programs, debugs, support, and modify software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs.
• Complete documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance. May work with users to define system requirements or necessary modifications.

What you'll bring:
• 6 plus years of software development with automated testing and DevOps Experience.
• Knowledge in deployment automation tools (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Nomad, etc.)
• Knowledge in Distributed Systems and the challenges that come with them
• Knowledge of testing technologies, patterns, and strategies.
• Java language skills
• Experience with testing frameworks (JUnit, Cucumber, Karate, or similar) and concepts (CHO, Integration, Unit, etc. )
• Experience with Behavior-driven Development (BDD)
• Experience Designing, Scoping, and Building large projects

About Global Tech

Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and lead the next retail change. People are why we improve, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered.

We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity and those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new experience for virtually every industry, or use your expertise to change at scale millions and reimagine the future of retail.

Flexible, hybrid work

We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily virtual, while remaining near the locations Global Tech calls home. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team, be more flexible in our personal lives and spend less time commuting. Of course, being together in person is an important part of our culture and shared success. We use our campuses to collaborate and be together in person, as business needs require and for development and networking opportunities.

Benefits & Perks:

Beyond a great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 3 years' experience in software engineering or related area.Option 2: 5 years' experience in software engineering or related area.

Company Overview

At Modernize (a QuinStreet division) our mission is to simplify home improvement by inspiring motivated homeowners and connecting them with qualified contractors. Our foundation is based on 10 years as a driving force as Home Improvement Leads in online lead generation – connecting homeowners with high–quality contractors – in the $300 billion annually grossing home improvement market. We’re working hard on a new brand and new products to cater to homeowners and the most successful contractors in the industry.

We’re looking for sharp, motivated individuals to join our growing team. Teammates who enjoy using technology to solve problems will thrive in our dynamic startup environment. We have an open floor plan that encourages the entire team to participate in critical discussions and allows everyone to be a vital contributing factor. You’ll enjoy our hip, newly renovated office in the heart of downtown with a view of the capital and the downtown skyline.

Covid-19 Hiring Update: As a company, we’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and will continue to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options.

Job Category

Are you a self-motivated critical thinker who is driven to succeed and likes to have fun doing it? Our downtown office space has an open floor plan that encourages collaboration and pushing each other to be our best. We take care of our team as well; a solid benefits package, quarterly bonuses, regular company outings, free coffee, beer, snacks, music, and great co-workers are all included with employment at Modernize Home Services.

In this position, you will research, design, build, test, deploy, and maintain web applications and microsites. Your knowledge of web development and user experience combined with programming skills will be put to the test as you build out websites that optimize the experience of millions of online users. Working in a tight-knit team environment, you will participate in design discussions, code reviews, sprint planning, and deployments. We are seeking applicants that have a passion for front-end development and a desire to learn and grow quickly.

Responsibilities
• Develop mobile-first responsive websites
• Build websites with an eye on usability, conversion, and attention to detail
• Participate in the refinement and ideation of user interface A/B tests
• Define new features that ensure a high performing and scalable user experience for all users
• Collaborate with peers on technical design, work estimation, and feature implementation
• Participate in sprint planning by understanding the effort, risk, and priority of remaining work committed for each release
• Perform peer code reviews and collaborate with the team to improve overall code quality
• Contribute ideas for continually improving the team's productivity, release quality, and job enjoyment

Experience
• 6 months of full-time experience in web development (HTML/CSS/JavaScript).
• Solid grasp of best practices for front end development
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to present and translate complex information to internal teams
• Experience translating a design from Sketch or Adobe Photoshop into code

Nice to haves:
• Understanding of front-end build processes including gulp and webpack
• Experience with SQL and databases
• Experience with Agile Scrum
• Experience with CMS platforms like WordPress
• Experience with React and consuming API’s

Who you are:
• Loves to solve problems
• Motivated, driven, and works well autonomously
• Always researching a better, more efficient way to build something

The expected salary range for this position is $65,000 USD to $85,000 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on the Company’s compensation practices. The salary may be adjusted based on applicant's geographic location. The position is also eligible to receive performance bonus or commission and equity in the form of restricted stock units. This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s standard employee benefits programs, which currently include health care benefits; (2) retirement benefits; (3) the amount of paid days off (paid sick leave, parental leave, paid time off, or vacation benefits); (4) any other tax-reportable benefits.

Modernize (a QuinStreet division) is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, pregnancy status, sex, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Please see QuinStreet’s Employee Privacy Notice here.

Optimizely is focused on unlocking digital potential and we are the recognized category leader in Digital Experience Platform (DXP) and created the category for A/B Testing and experimentation software. We have incredible customers – isn’t that one of the most important aspects of looking for your next job? Optimizely has over 9,000 brands from global organizations such as Visa, Sky, Yamaha, Wall Street Journal to tech innovators like Atlassian, DocuSign, FitBit and Zillow.

Not only are we financially sound and growing but we have unicorn status: Exceeded $300M in revenue in 2020, is profitable already, and has all strategic options ahead of itself. Optimizely continues to invest and addresses a market opportunity north of $30 billion, providing significant personal career growth opportunities.

We are an inclusive culture with a global team of 1200+ people across the US, Europe, Australia, and Vietnam. We blend European and American business culture with emphasis on teamwork, inclusion, and moving fast. People make the difference!

We are embracing Open-Source technology using React-Native, React.js to build a front end, mobile experience and cloud native backend services using Java/NodeJS. Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. Senior Frontend Developer

About Us

Climate change is one of the existential crises of our times, and the question remains: how much hotter are we going to let it get?

Founded at the University of Chicago, Climate Vault's mission is to help organizations and individuals voluntarily reduce their carbon footprints and foster innovation in carbon removal.

Building on our early success, we are building our team to have an even greater impact. As a fast-growing startup, we are searching for ambitious team members who love building and growing an organization. Our culture is important to us - we are searching for individuals who have a passion for progress and constant improvement while meeting goals and getting things done.

This opportunity is perfect for someone who wants to have a significant positive impact on our customers and the world around us, as we combat climate change one ton at a time.

Duties and Responsibilities

Climate Vault is seeking a Senior Frontend Angular Developer to join our frontend team for the new initiatives to help companies to achieve carbon neutrality with the least overhead. As one of the early members, you will be able to shape the culture, processes and technical foundations of the team.

• Strong sense of responsibility

Job Title: Frontend Developer

Location: Remote (EST Time Zone)

Position Type: Full Time/Permanent

Exciting start-up in the renewable energy industry is growing and in need of a skilled and experienced Frontend Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a Frontend Software Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in working alongside our talented UI/UX designers to create visually captivating and user-friendly interfaces for both web and mobile applications within the renewable energy industry.

Salary + Bonus + Stock

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate closely with our UI/UX designers to implement visually captivating and intuitive interfaces for web and mobile applications.
• Utilize your expertise in ReactJS, Three.js, and other relevant technologies to develop interfaces that enable visualization and editing of multimedia assets in both 2D and 3D formats.
• Employ your proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, and CSS to write clean, efficient, and scalable code.
• Optimize and enhance front-end performance to ensure fast and responsive user experiences.
• Identify and implement web-based user interactions that improve usability and accessibility.
• Estimate resources, including effort and team size, as well as timelines required for feature delivery and task completion.

• Possess a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Development, Engineering, or a related technical field. We also welcome strong candidates who have completed a reputable bootcamp program or have over three years of professional experience.
• Showcase demonstrated experience in frontend development through contributions to production software or an impressive portfolio of personal projects.
• Proven experience in designing and implementing experimentation within frontend products, including involvement in large-scale experiments.
• Familiarity with commonly used programming tools such as Redux, IDEs, RESTful APIs, Git repositories, TypeScript, version control software, and remote deployment tools.
• Knowledge of testing frameworks and methodologies, including unit testing, integration testing, and automated testing.
• Understanding of Agile principles and practices, such as Scrum or Kanban, with previous experience working in Agile teams.
• Strong ability to collaborate effectively, prioritize tasks, and deliver incremental software iterations while adapting to evolving requirements and maintaining a customer-centric focus.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate seamlessly with UI/UX designers and the development team. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills are a must.
• Keen attention to detail and a genuine passion for delivering outstanding user experiences.

data.job_description:
The Opportunity:

Vianai is looking for an experienced Frontend Developer who will define and deliver the strategy and roadmap for a human-centered AI experience throughout a growing collection of ML products. Our ideal Frontend Developer is hands-on, collaborative, self-motivated, and innovative. She or he should be as excited as we are to create human-centered AI products poised for rapid growth and continued success.

Expectations:
• The candidate will be part of the ML data science and engineering team to build complex interfaces from the ground up for enterprise scale.
• Collaborate with a diverse team of Designers, Developers, Engineers, and Data Scientists.
• Translate designs and wireframes into high quality user interfaces.
• Demonstrates up-to-date expertise in Software Engineering and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans.
• Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability.
• Communicate and present their work in a clear and simple manner with relationship skills and a strong team player.

Qualifications:
• BS in Computer Science, Human Machine Interface Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or equivalent.
• 5 years experience with web application development using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other industry standard frameworks.
• 3 years experience with data visualization frameworks such as D3.
• Passion for simplicity and an ability to clearly present complex data in a consumable manner across multiple chart/graph types.
• In-depth hands-on experience with industry standard frameworks like React or similar.
• Confident hands-on from initial wireframes, prototyping, converging to final application.
• Good understanding of asynchronous request handling (AJAX).
• Experience with RESTful APIs and unit testing.
• Meticulous attention to technical and visual details.
• Curious about new technology, able to change quickly.

Preferred Qualifications:
• MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Human Machine Interface Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or equivalent.
• Hands on experience in full stack web application development.
• Familiar with data stack applications like SQL Database, Data warehouse, Kafka etc.
• Knowledge in Business Intelligence, Machine Learning.

Who We Are:

We are a team of engineers, designers, doers, makers, and thought leaders. We are also sisters and brothers, fathers and mothers, partners and friends. We are curious and creative, confident and humble and we have a passion for what’s next. We believe that when used to amplify our humanity, our technology has the power to do good in the world.

While Vianai is a part of each one of us, it isn’t all of us.

Our company is founded on a culture of trust, empowerment, and respect. We bring our whole self to work — the non-perfect, messy, sometimes imposter, sometimes expert, sometimes vulnerable, and sometimes superhuman self that contributes to what we believe in. We are committed to advancing inclusion, equity, and diversity because we believe that to design more transparent and beneficial AI systems, we need architects of all types. And to us, the more perspectives the better.

Vianai has deep expertise in enterprise technologies and landscapes, business application development, engineering services, design thinking, and cutting-edge AI research. We are a startup, and we are founded, funded, and led by veterans of the industry. We think and work like entrepreneurs, but we’ve brought a wealth of experience and expertise that is deeply relevant to our mission and the market opportunity.

About Vianai:

Vianai is a Human-Centered AI platform and products company amplifying the power of human understanding and collaboration together with advanced AI techniques, to drive transformation. Vianai’s unique human-centered approach empowers data professionals and domain experts to leverage causal data science, drive deeper intelligence into decision making and improve business outcomes. Vianai customers include many of the world’s largest and most respected companies in manufacturing, financial services, retail, and aerospace and defense, among many others. The company is headquartered in Palo Alto, California, and has an R&D center in Israel.
